For early access brewing/alternative I think using the cauldron would be more appropriate. Having the cauldron over a heat source block (lava, campfire, magma block) would "heat" the cauldron, after that adding ingredients, could make potions, however, less power than a brewstand with a "drawback". For example, you have Haste for 3min you'll have Slowness afterward for 3mins, making a brew stand the "refined" option but allowing players to use potions in survival early on. One way to make the cauldron method appealing in later game would be that you could mix up to 3 potions worth of ingredients (Water breathing, haste, strength), but also you'd get all three drawbacks related to each. This could be trumped by potion sacks/holders/bundle upgrades that would allow potions to be stacked naturally as long as all the components are the same. Having several potions that won't give you drawbacks or one potion that will give you a boost but leave you vulnerable some way afterward makes a player strategize for sure.

I saw a magic scroll data pack that ides this idea of Casting Magic, I agree if implemented it should be something that draws down on the XP to regulate it and make players consider use. Certainly a little easier than adding a mana system. Though most Casting Magic would probably be played somewhere in between bing buffs like potions or ranged effects like bows and tridents already provide, making it a bit tricky in my opinion, I would love to see a magic expansion in Minecraft. Typically a more magical fantasy setting ends up with a less technological push. 

Some potential book/scroll/rune ideas though, some pulled from other mods/data packs

Fire Dart - half heart impact with the target set aflame

Water Dart- puts out fires and acts like a rapidly dropped bucket (water moving out 8 spaces as it would), ergo given it has range and can push entities as well it's pretty powerful without any damage effects.

Chilling Dart - adds slowness and for the target sees the cold effect of powder snow, 1/2 heart for impact

Wind Knock - Knocks back target (no damage)

Idea Update: we can also find many magical artifacts in chests or during excavation in archaeological sites. This include:

Catalyts: similar to wands, we can use them to perform an attack

Amulets: items that if held, give special bonuses when using magic, such us increasing the effectiveness or reducing the costs

Totems: similar to catalysts but more rare and powerful 

Book and Grimoires: have special spells written in them

This idea seems a bit too OP

Maybe you have to search for staffs which have different elemental stones set in them (i.e. Fire, water, earth, wind) would make it more balanced

Magic protection is a good idea though

Have you been able to build wands with lesser elemental stones and be able to find the greater stones in the end therefore increaseing game length and change if you add mobs (and why are we making the dragons extinct)
JUST TO CLARIFY! Im not talking about Chunk Render Distance! Im talking about how far away you can see characters or "players" in a world.

I think this should be formulated better if you want to get some upvotes. Consider "Increase the distance at which players can be seen". Please edit it: nobody else can write their own submission because it would be marked as a duplicate to yours.

I would love to see potions get an expansion, there are plenty of status effects that Mojang still hasn't touched on, and I also think these should be adds:

Mundane Potions, are similar to the regulars but have a drawback that kicks in after the benefit, these are brewable in a cauldron as well for earlier potion play. Ex. Haste 1 min followed by Slowness 1min. 

Either allow potions to be stacked (8 or 16 would be good) or... allow the Cauldron to mix potions, this is an incredibly fun mechanic and makes strategizing effects important. Now you can't mix to increase time, but you do get to save space with a potion of Water Breathing, Haste, and Night vision in one go.

I would love potions to get their own update, right now they are too much of a "grind" to make for only 3 to 8 minutes of actually using them, and with beacons they are more useless than ever, BUT.

Potions aren't big enough to have their own update, maybe over time they make them better but there is a lot of better stuff to do :(

I think 1.21 should include a minor potion update, but it wouldn’t be anything too extreme such as changing the potion system mechanics. Instead, this minor update would include multiple new potions. This is similar to how 1.20 included a minor desert update. Even though this is a minor update, there would be a lot of new potions. There should be at least ten new potions, but I want a lot of potions to be added. This update will have super creative and unique potions. Examples include: Potion of Nullifying, Potion of Revulsion, Potion of Serenity, Potion of Nausea, Milk bottles, Lava bottles, Potion of Peace, Potion of Levitation, Potion of Multiplying, The Potion of Spider Crawling,  Potion of Everlasting Youth, ect. It is not guaranteed that any of these will be added. These are just examples of unique and creative potion ideas.

I think if multiple sounds are happening at once it should kind of stun the warden. Like a bunch of tnt explosions all around. Not how loud sounds are. Cause it’s gonna look silly when the warden walks back and forth back and forth when you jump or make a sound somewhere then shoot an arrow across the room and make him go back and forth quickly.

this should be with any mob that can't have a lead like enderman

 

Edit: don't know why this hasn't been in the game already

This is a much needed QoL change.  While minecarts now have activator rails to automatically eject riders there is no equivalent for boats.

Having to break boats because a wandering villager, trader, or hostile mob fell into it gets tedious.  Especially now that chest boats are a thing and breaking the boat dumps the contents of the chest which villagers and some hostile mobs can than potentially steal from the player.

Freezing would now have to be a status effect for this idea to work. That's actually a great idea for a suggestion in itself.

Since players don't have multiple hitboxes (the Enderdragon is the only mob that does) the part-specific armor protection wouldn't work as the game currently stands.

Instead, how about freezing time is reduced for each piece of leather armor worn, and the full set negates it? Then maybe Frost Aspect 2 could have a stronger effect that leather armor can't fully block?

I like the fact that "hot" mobs would take more damage, this could be good for Blaze farms. I'd like to add that "cold" mobs should be immune. It should go by how Powder Snow currently works.

Conversely, although it's an immersive idea, Frost Aspect should not be disabled in the Nether, unless Powder Snow is changed to not work in the Nether also (which should be the case anyways).

How about "sandy"(or dirty) concrete, scorched bricks (as in the bricks block), corroded sandstone &  sandy/scorched/corroded stone bricks (to tie it together & to go along with the fact that stone bricks is the only block to have both the cracked & mossy variants)

The only one to share all the "age properties" should be stone bricks, to increase the creativity in how the blocks must be used.

This is a great idea! 

There are a few mods that allow right clicking (like striping logs) concrete and bricks to crack them, and it would be a better way than crafting them like we do now to play with these blocks
Cool Idea!

Yesterday I logged on to my Java Minecraft and I saw the message; Be Anti-Racist! I was so happy. But it got me thinking. If Minecraft is such a diverse community with people playing from all different ethnic backgrounds, why do only have on color of villager. This just seemed slightly wrong to me.
Different hair sizes and things like that all over the board keep some features the same they can all have big noses still
Also different eye colors. I don't know if you've noticed, but villagers only have green eyes.
As long as they don't overlap too much with the Illager subspecies, more skin and eye color and even different unibrow colors for the Villagers would be great.

I think that the pet bed idea has some real merit. Many people playing in survival mode probably won't be able to get a single totem of undying, much less have enough to share between themselves and all their pets.

The dog or cat could curl up inside a small bed similar to how the fox mob curls up in a little ball.
The bed could look like a 1 by 1 by 1/2 boat/slab, except the texture of the item would have a colored exterior with white in the inside, almost like a puffy dog bed in real life. It could be crafted with white and colored wool and maybe even feathers. (And the color of the colored wool determines the outside of the bed, but the inside is always white.)

Here are some ideas for the crafting table grid:
Three colored wool on the bottom row of the crafting grid, with two more colored wool on the outer two spaces on the middle row. In the center of the middle row can have either a single piece of white wool or a feather.
Or you could have it be made from 2 colored wool on the outer spaces of the bottom row, with a white wool or a feather in between them.

Having a bed for your pets makes it so that your pets can still die if you don't have a pet bed (or enough pet beds), but that it is reasonably easy to prevent a pet from fatally dying.

How about a craftable collar that you can make by using a totem of undying and 3 string or 1 lead? I feel something like that would be a little more within the range of Minecraft's capabilities when it comes to quality of life upgrades. Another idea I have is the option to feed your pets golden apples and enchanted golden apples. Right now, there's already one pet-like mob that can eat either of those and get their status effects (fox), and any mob can already get potion effects through splash potions. There's even a function for undead mobs to get the opposite of a certain status effect if splashed (potions of healing harm undeads). With all of that in mind, I feel like a function like that would be both convenient and plausible.
I like it :)

It should not provide zero protection, it should be an upgrade to leather that provides as much protection as chainmail & also prevents freezing. They should bring back the need for a full set of leather to prevent freezing, however one piece of wool armor would protect from freezing. (Real cloth armor provided surprisingly good protection, much better than leather...)
